conclusion: Identify forces acting on the suitcase: gravitational, normal, pulling, and frictional forces.
Normal force balances gravitational force not countered by upward pull.
Pulling force is 90 N at angle θ with horizontal.
Frictional force is proportional to normal force: f = μN.
Set up horizontal equilibrium equation: F cos(θ) = μN.
Set up vertical equilibrium equation: N + F sin(θ) = F_g.
Substitute vertical equation into horizontal to eliminate N.
Minimum pulling force occurs when normal force is minimized.
Assume angle θ is given or determined from context.
Conclusion: Need numerical methods or assumptions to solve for μ and θ.
